N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 621.12 - Fees and charges in connection with a Facilities Development Corporation loan

State Regulations
(a) Charges
for development period. The charge payable to OPWDD by the voluntary
agency for services rendered in connection with an FDC mortgage loan from the
inception of the project to, but not including, the initial occupancy date, shall be. 9 of one percent of the loan, payable on requisition on the date of
the mortgage closing. (b) Charges for operational period. The charge payable to OPWDD by
the voluntary agency during the period from the occupancy date to the end of
the loan term shall be an annual charge of.2 of one percent of the mortgage
loan, payable on a monthly or other periodic basis pursuant to an assignment
which shall be required from the voluntary agency to OPWDD to be made in the
format prescribed by the commissioner. For facilities for which the voluntary
agency receives reimbursement rates or fees as a result of services rendered to
OPWDD and/or the New York State Medicaid program, such assignment may require
the annual charge to be paid from the periodic payment of the voluntary
agency's rate or fee reimbursement. (c) MCFFA charges other than annual
administrative charges. The charges imposed by MCFFA due to its cost
and expenses in connection with the issuance of bonds and notes to finance the
facility shall be payable to OPWDD by the voluntary agency on requisition on
the date of the mortgage closing. (d) MCFFA annual administrative
charges. The annual administrative charges imposed by MCFFA shall be
payable to OPWDD by the voluntary agency from the date of the mortgage loan
closing, on a monthly or other periodic basis pursuant to an assignment which
shall be required from the voluntary agency to OPWDD to be made in the format
prescribed by the Commissioner. For facilities for which the voluntary agency
receives reimbursement rates or fees as a result of services rendered to OPWDD
and/or the New York State Medicaid program, such assignment may require the
annual charge to be paid from the periodic payment of the voluntary agency's
rate or fee reimbursement. Notes
